page.title: 04Hutton Buscel
page.content: {Hutton Buscel }is a quiet country village. Most of the houses are stone built. There are six farms and also a retirement home called The Holt. It has a twelfth century church.There is no shop in{Hutton Buscel}but the bread man,the fish man, the butcher,the lemonade man, the ice cream man and the library van come round serving the residents of the village.The nearest town is{Scarborough}which is six and a half miles away.{Hutton Buscel}was mentioned in the original{Domesday {Book {St Matthews Church Hutton Buscel.. } The church was built in 1134 the Norman tower is the most interesting part of the church.There is a consideerable amount of oak in the church, mostly modern except the altar of the Lady Chapel. This dates back to the early 17th century and is most
